title: 112_s1062
content: ENHANCEMENT OF ADMINISTRATION OF THE UNITED STATES AIR FORCE INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY. The United States Air Force Institute of Technology's administration is being enhanced with the addition of a new section in Chapter 901 of title 10, United States Code. The Commandant of the institute will be selected by the Secretary of the Air Force and can be an active-duty officer or a civilian individual with specific qualifications. The Commandant of the United States Air Force Institute of Technology must be a brigadier general or higher, selected by the Secretary of the Air Force based on specified criteria and consultation with relevant individuals. The Commandant of the United States Air Force Institute of Technology is selected by the Secretary of the Air Force based on specific criteria and consultations with relevant individuals. The Technology Subcommittee of the Air University Board of Visitors considers recommendations from the leadership and faculty of the Institute and the Chief of Staff of the Air Force. The civilian Commandant serves a five-year term, with the possibility of an additional five-year term, and must have relevant qualifications for the position. The qualifications for the position of Commandant at the United States Air Force Institute of Technology include a doctorate or master's degree in a relevant field, with exceptions for active-duty or retired Air Force officers of a certain rank. The Commandant at the United States Air Force Institute of Technology must have a doctorate degree relevant to the institute's mission, a comprehensive understanding of the Department of the Air Force and Department of Defense, senior leadership experience, and the ability to foster and encourage. The United States Air Force Institute of Technology requires the Commandant to have a doctorate degree relevant to the institute's mission, senior leadership experience, and the ability to foster academic excellence. Additionally, a Provost and Academic Dean position is established at the institute. The Provost and Academic Dean at the United States Air Force Institute of Technology is appointed by the Secretary for a five-year term after consultation with relevant committees. The compensation for this position is determined by the Secretary, not exceeding a specified rate. The compensation for the Provost and Academic Dean at the United States Air Force Institute of Technology is determined by the Secretary, not exceeding the rate authorized for level IV of the Executive Schedule. The officer currently serving as Commandant of the United States Air Force Institute of Technology may continue in an acting capacity until a new Commandant is appointed in accordance with section 9314b(a) of title 10, United States Code.
